result.arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُزَّمِّلُ
result.translation: O you the enwrapped one[1],
result.footnotes: [1] Allah is addressing the Messenger (ﷺ), who was wrapped in his garments.

result.arabic_text: قُمِ ٱلَّيۡلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلٗا
result.translation: Stand up in prayer at night except a little,

result.arabic_text: نِّصۡفَهُۥٓ أَوِ ٱنقُصۡ مِنۡهُ قَلِيلًا
result.translation: half of it, or a little less,

result.arabic_text: أَوۡ زِدۡ عَلَيۡهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَرۡتِيلًا
result.translation: or a little more, and recite the Qur’an at a measured pace.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّا سَنُلۡقِي عَلَيۡكَ قَوۡلٗا ثَقِيلًا
result.translation: We will send down upon you a heavy Word[2].
result.footnotes: [2] i.e., the revelation, which the Prophet (ﷺ) would feel its great weight when descending upon him. Also, it is heavy for its ordinances, rulings, punishments, ethics, etc.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّيۡلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطۡـٔٗا وَأَقۡوَمُ قِيلًا
result.translation: Indeed, worship at night is more effective[3] and more conducive to proper recitation[4].
result.footnotes:
[3] Or "getting up at night is more difficult...," meaning that it can only be done by sincere believers.
 [4] i.e., for reciting, hearing, and understanding of the Qur’an.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ لَكَ فِي ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبۡحٗا طَوِيلٗا
result.translation: In the daytime, you have plenty of time for your worldly matters.

result.arabic_text: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلۡ إِلَيۡهِ تَبۡتِيلٗا
result.translation: And remember the Name of your Lord, and devote yourself completely to Him.

result.arabic_text: رَّبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذۡهُ وَكِيلٗا
result.translation: [He is] Lord of the east and the west; none has the right to be worshiped except Him, so take Him as the Disposer of your affairs[5].
result.footnotes: [5] i.e., trust in Allah and rely upon Him in all your matters.

result.arabic_text: وَٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهۡجُرۡهُمۡ هَجۡرٗا جَمِيلٗا
result.translation: Bear patiently what they say, and avoid them in a gracious manner.

result.arabic_text: وَذَرۡنِي وَٱلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ أُوْلِي ٱلنَّعۡمَةِ وَمَهِّلۡهُمۡ قَلِيلًا
result.translation: Leave to Me the deniers who are having a life of luxury, and bear with them for a little while.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ لَدَيۡنَآ أَنكَالٗا وَجَحِيمٗا
result.translation: Indeed, We have heavy shackles and a Blazing Fire,

result.arabic_text: وَطَعَامٗا ذَا غُصَّةٖ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمٗا
result.translation: and food that chokes, and a painful punishment,

result.arabic_text: يَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَثِيبٗا مَّهِيلًا
result.translation: on the Day when the earth and the mountains will convulse, and the mountains will be like dunes of loose sand.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡكُمۡ رَسُولٗا شَٰهِدًا عَلَيۡكُمۡ كَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ رَسُولٗا
result.translation: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger to be a witness over you, just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.

result.arabic_text: فَعَصَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ أَخۡذٗا وَبِيلٗا
result.translation: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a severe punishment.

result.arabic_text: فَكَيۡفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرۡتُمۡ يَوۡمٗا يَجۡعَلُ ٱلۡوِلۡدَٰنَ شِيبًا
result.translation: If you disbelieve, then how will you protect yourselves against a Day that will turn children’s hair gray?

result.arabic_text: ٱلسَّمَآءُ مُنفَطِرُۢ بِهِۦۚ كَانَ وَعۡدُهُۥ مَفۡعُولًا
result.translation: It will cause the sky to break asunder[6]. His promise will certainly be fulfilled.
result.footnotes: [6] Out of the terror of that Day.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا
result.translation: Indeed, this is a reminder; so whoever wills may take a way to his Lord.

result.arabic_text: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعۡلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدۡنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَيِ ٱلَّيۡلِ وَنِصۡفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَآئِفَةٞ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَعَكَۚ وَٱللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّيۡلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحۡصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيۡكُمۡۖ فَٱقۡرَءُواْ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرۡضَىٰ وَءَاخَرُونَ يَضۡرِبُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ يَبۡتَغُونَ مِن فَضۡلِ ٱللَّهِ وَءَاخَرُونَ يُقَٰتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِۖ فَٱقۡرَءُواْ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنۡهُۚ وَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُواْ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقۡرِضُواْ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗاۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُواْ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنۡ خَيۡرٖ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيۡرٗا وَأَعۡظَمَ أَجۡرٗاۚ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرُواْ ٱللَّهَۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمُۢ
result.translation: Indeed, your Lord knows that you [O Prophet] stand up in prayer for nearly two-thirds of the night, or half of it, or one-third of it, as do others among your companions. Allah determines the night and the day; He knows that you [Muslims] cannot keep an accurate count of it, so He pardoned you[7]. Recite then as much of the Qur’an as is easy for you [in the night prayers]. He knows that there are some among you who will be ill, and others traveling in the land, seeking the grace of Allah, and others fighting in Allah’s way. So recite as much of it as is easy for you; establish prayer and give zakah; and lend to Allah a goodly loan[8]. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you will find it with Allah, much better in condition and much greater in reward[9]. And seek forgiveness of Allah, for indeed Allah is All-Forgiving, Most-Merciful.
result.footnotes:
[7] The ruling mentioned at the beginning of this surah is lightened here. So from now on, the believers do not have to stick to any of the portions specified there; rather, they can pray whatever they can at night. It is out of the mercy of Allah upon His servants that He does not want hardship for them.
 [8] i.e., giving in charity and for His causes.
 [9] It will be rewarded tenfold, or 700-fold, and Allah gives even more to whoever He wills. See 2:261.
